item.title: 0.9.9.6 rc6
item.description:
This changelog also covers the previous five 64-bit release candidates.

As you've all noticed, I haven't finished the Atlantis 2.0 clean rewrite in Swift I had started. As you've also all noticed, Catalina no longer will support 32-bit applications, which means Atlantis needed a rebuild. Hence the 0.9.9.6 line.

  • Atlantis is now a 64-bit application and so will run under Catalina.
  • Input area will no longer en-smarten quotes.
  • Automatically disables dark mode until Atlantis can be rewritten to support it.
  • The Growl notification functionality will now also automatically support Notification Center.
  • Fixes for a number of crashes and bugs that arose due to aging code.
  • Unfortunately, scripting is no longer functional. Neither CamelBones (written by my late friend Sherm Pendley) nor the Lua framework I used are supported anymore, and neither can compile under modern tools. I will be redoing the script system, but the 64-bit release was more immediately pressing.

This is really just a sort of temporary build, one that fixed a couple of bugs for various friends, and where I began working on the 64-bit conversion. It's only in here as a placeholder so the appcast has somewhere to start before 0.9.9.6 real-version comes out.
